properties.description: Unique topic prefix that is used as a prefix for all schemas and topics. Each distinct installation should have a separate namespace and be monitored by at most one Debezium connector.
properties.name: topic.prefix

properties.description: Resolvable hostname or IP address of the database server.
properties.name: database.hostname

properties.description: Port of the database server.
properties.name: database.port

properties.description: Name of the database user to be used when connecting to the database.
properties.name: database.user

properties.description: Password of the database user to be used when connecting to the database.
properties.name: database.password

properties.description: The name of the database the connector should be monitoring
properties.name: database.dbname

properties.description: Whether to use an encrypted connection to Postgres. Options include'disable' (the default) to use an unencrypted connection; 'require' to use a secure (encrypted) connection, and fail if one cannot be established; 'verify-ca' like 'required' but additionally verify the server TLS certificate against the configured Certificate Authority (CA) certificates, or fail if no valid matching CA certificates are found; or'verify-full' like 'verify-ca' but additionally verify that the server certificate matches the host to which the connection is attempted.
properties.name: database.sslmode

properties.description: File containing the SSL Certificate for the client. See the Postgres SSL docs for further information
properties.name: database.sslcert

properties.description: Password to access the client private key from the file specified by 'database.sslkey'. See the Postgres SSL docs for further information
properties.name: database.sslpassword

properties.description: File containing the root certificate(s) against which the server is validated. See the Postgres JDBC SSL docs for further information
properties.name: database.sslrootcert

properties.description: File containing the SSL private key for the client. See the Postgres SSL docs for further information
properties.name: database.sslkey

properties.description: A name of class to that creates SSL Sockets. Use org.postgresql.ssl.NonValidatingFactory to disable SSL validation in development environments
properties.name: database.sslfactory

properties.description: Enable or disable TCP keep-alive probe to avoid dropping TCP connection
properties.name: database.tcpKeepAlive

properties.description: A semicolon separated list of SQL statements to be executed when a JDBC connection to the database is established. Note that the connector may establish JDBC connections at its own discretion, so this should typically be used for configurationof session parameters only, but not for executing DML statements. Use doubled semicolon (';;') to use a semicolon as a character and not as a delimiter.
properties.name: database.initial.statements

properties.description: The name of the Postgres logical decoding plugin installed on the server. Supported values are 'decoderbufs', 'wal2json', 'pgoutput', 'wal2json_streaming', 'wal2json_rds' and 'wal2json_rds_streaming'. Defaults to 'decoderbufs'.
properties.name: plugin.name

properties.description: The name of the Postgres logical decoding slot created for streaming changes from a plugin.Defaults to 'debezium
properties.name: slot.name

properties.description: Any optional parameters used by logical decoding plugin. Semi-colon separated. E.g. 'add-tables=public.table,public.table2;include-lsn=true'
properties.displayName: Optional parameters to pass to the logical decoder when the stream is started.
properties.name: slot.stream.params

properties.description: Whether or not to drop the logical replication slot when the connector finishes orderlyBy default the replication is kept so that on restart progress can resume from the last recorded location
properties.name: slot.drop.on.stop

properties.description: How many times to retry connecting to a replication slot when an attempt fails.
properties.name: slot.max.retries

properties.description: Time to wait between retry attempts when the connector fails to connect to a replication slot, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 10 seconds (10,000 ms).
properties.name: slot.retry.delay.ms

properties.description: Frequency for sending replication connection status updates to the server, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 10 seconds (10,000 ms).
properties.name: status.update.interval.ms

properties.description: Specify how often (in ms) the xmin will be fetched from the replication slot. This xmin value is exposed by the slot which gives a lower bound of where a new replication slot could start from. The lower the value, the more likely this value is to be the current 'true' value, but the bigger the performance cost. The bigger the value, the less likely this value is to be the current 'true' value, but the lower the performance penalty. The default is set to 0 ms, which disables tracking xmin.
properties.name: xmin.fetch.interval.ms

properties.description: The name of the Postgres 10+ publication used for streaming changes from a plugin.Defaults to 'dbz_publication'
properties.name: publication.name

properties.description: Applies only when streaming changes using pgoutput.Determine how creation of a publication should work, the default is all_tables.DISABLED - The connector will not attempt to create a publication at all. The expectation is that the user has created the publication up-front. If the publication isn't found to exist upon startup, the connector will throw an exception and stop.ALL_TABLES - If no publication exists, the connector will create a new publication for all tables. Note this requires that the configured user has access. If the publication already exists, it will be used. i.e CREATE PUBLICATION <publication_name> FOR ALL TABLES;FILTERED - If no publication exists, the connector will create a new publication for all those tables matchingthe current filter configuration (see table/database include/exclude list properties). If the publication already exists, it will be used. i.e CREATE PUBLICATION <publication_name> FOR TABLE <tbl1, tbl2, etc>
properties.name: publication.autocreate.mode

properties.description: The schemas for which events should be captured
properties.name: schema.include.list

properties.description: The schemas for which events must not be captured
properties.name: schema.exclude.list

properties.description: The tables for which changes are to be captured
properties.name: table.include.list

properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions that match the fully-qualified names of tables to be excluded from monitoring
properties.name: table.exclude.list

properties.description: Regular expressions matching columns to include in change events
properties.name: column.include.list

properties.description: Regular expressions matching columns to exclude from change events
properties.name: column.exclude.list

properties.description: Flag specifying whether built-in tables should be ignored.
properties.name: table.ignore.builtin

properties.description: The criteria for running a snapshot upon startup of the connector. Options include: 'always' to specify that the connector run a snapshot each time it starts up; 'initial' (the default) to specify the connector can run a snapshot only when no offsets are available for the logical server name; 'initial_only' same as 'initial' except the connector should stop after completing the snapshot and before it would normally start emitting changes;'never' to specify the connector should never run a snapshot and that upon first startup the connector should read from the last position (LSN) recorded by the server; and'exported' to specify the connector should run a snapshot based on the position when the replication slot was created; 'custom' to specify a custom class with 'snapshot.custom_class' which will be loaded and used to determine the snapshot, see docs for more details.
properties.name: snapshot.mode

properties.description: The maximum number of records that should be loaded into memory while performing a snapshot
properties.name: snapshot.fetch.size

properties.description: A delay period before a snapshot will begin, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 0 ms.
properties.name: snapshot.delay.ms

properties.description: The maximum number of millis to wait for table locks at the beginning of a snapshot. If locks cannot be acquired in this time frame, the snapshot will be aborted. Defaults to 10 seconds
properties.name: snapshot.lock.timeout.ms

properties.description: This property contains a comma-separated list of fully-qualified tables (DB_NAME.TABLE_NAME) or (SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME), depending on thespecific connectors . Select statements for the individual tables are specified in further configuration properties, one for each table, identified by the id 'snapshot.select.statement.overrides.[DB_NAME].[TABLE_NAME]' or 'snapshot.select.statement.overrides.[SCHEMA_NAME].[TABLE_NAME]', respectively. The value of those properties is the select statement to use when retrieving data from the specific table during snapshotting. A possible use case for large append-only tables is setting a specific point where to start (resume) snapshotting, in case a previous snapshotting was interrupted.
properties.displayName: List of tables where the default select statement used during snapshotting should be overridden.
properties.name: snapshot.select.statement.overrides

properties.description: When 'snapshot.mode' is set as custom, this setting must be set to specify a fully qualified class name to load (via the default class loader).This class must implement the 'Snapshotter' interface and is called on each app boot to determine whether to do a snapshot and how to build queries.
properties.name: snapshot.custom.class

properties.description: Whether delete operations should be represented by a delete event and a subsquenttombstone event (true) or only by a delete event (false). Emitting the tombstone event (the default behavior) allows Kafka to completely delete all events pertaining to the given key once the source record got deleted.
properties.displayName: Change the behaviour of Debezium with regards to delete operations
properties.name: tombstones.on.delete

properties.description: Specify how DECIMAL and NUMERIC columns should be represented in change events, including:'precise' (the default) uses java.math.BigDecimal to represent values, which are encoded in the change events using a binary representation and Kafka Connect's 'org.apache.kafka.connect.data.Decimal' type; 'string' uses string to represent values; 'double' represents values using Java's 'double', which may not offer the precision but will be far easier to use in consumers.
properties.name: decimal.handling.mode

properties.description: Time, date, and timestamps can be represented with different kinds of precisions, including:'adaptive' (the default) bases the precision of time, date, and timestamp values on the database column's precision; 'adaptive_time_microseconds' like 'adaptive' mode, but TIME fields always use microseconds precision;'connect' always represents time, date, and timestamp values using Kafka Connect's built-in representations for Time, Date, and Timestamp, which uses millisecond precision regardless of the database columns' precision .
properties.name: time.precision.mode

properties.description: Specify how INTERVAL columns should be represented in change events, including:'string' represents values as an exact ISO formatted string'numeric' (default) represents values using the inexact conversion into microseconds
properties.name: interval.handling.mode

properties.description: Specify how binary (blob, binary, etc.) columns should be represented in change events, including:'bytes' represents binary data as byte array (default)'base64' represents binary data as base64-encoded string'hex' represents binary data as hex-encoded (base16) string
properties.name: binary.handling.mode

properties.description: Specify how HSTORE columns should be represented in change events, including:'json' represents values as string-ified JSON (default)'map' represents values as a key/value map
properties.name: hstore.handling.mode

properties.description: Length of an interval in milli-seconds in in which the connector periodically sends heartbeat messages to a heartbeat topic. Use 0 to disable heartbeat messages. Disabled by default.
properties.name: heartbeat.interval.ms

properties.description: The prefix that is used to name heartbeat topics.Defaults to __debezium-heartbeat.
properties.displayName: A prefix used for naming of heartbeat topics
properties.name: heartbeat.topics.prefix

properties.description: The query executed with every heartbeat.
properties.displayName: An optional query to execute with every heartbeat
properties.name: heartbeat.action.query

properties.description: Optional list of custom converters that would be used instead of default ones. The converters are defined using '<converter.prefix>.type' config option and configured using options '<converter.prefix>.<option>'
properties.displayName: List of prefixes defining custom values converters.
properties.name: converters

properties.description: Specify the conditions that trigger a refresh of the in-memory schema for a table. 'columns_diff' (the default) is the safest mode, ensuring the in-memory schema stays in-sync with the database table's schema at all times. 'columns_diff_exclude_unchanged_toast' instructs the connector to refresh the in-memory schema cache if there is a discrepancy between it and the schema derived from the incoming message, unless unchanged TOASTable data fully accounts for the discrepancy. This setting can improve connector performance significantly if there are frequently-updated tables that have TOASTed data that are rarely part of these updates. However, it is possible for the in-memory schema to become outdated if TOASTable columns are dropped from the table.
properties.name: schema.refresh.mode

properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching fully-qualified names of columns that should be truncated to the configured amount of characters.
properties.name: column.truncate.to.(d+).chars

properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching fully-qualified names of columns that should be masked with configured amount of asterisk ('*') characters.
properties.name: column.mask.with.(d+).chars

properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching fully-qualified names of columns that should be masked by hashing the input. Using the specified hash algorithms and salt.
properties.displayName: Mask Columns Using Hash and Salt
properties.name: column.mask.hash.([^.]+).with.salt.(.+)

properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching the database-specific data type names that adds the data type's original type and original length as parameters to the corresponding field schemas in the emitted change records.
properties.displayName: Propagate Source Types by Data Type
properties.name: datatype.propagate.source.type

properties.description: A comma-separated list of regular expressions matching fully-qualified names of columns that  adds the columnâ€™s original type and original length as parameters to the corresponding field schemas in the emitted change records.
properties.name: column.propagate.source.type

properties.description: A semicolon-separated list of expressions that match fully-qualified tables and column(s) to be used as message key. Each expression must match the pattern '<fully-qualified table name>:<key columns>',where the table names could be defined as (DB_NAME.TABLE_NAME) or (SCHEMA_NAME.TABLE_NAME), depending on the specific connector,and the key columns are a comma-separated list of columns representing the custom key. For any table without an explicit key configuration the table's primary key column(s) will be used as message key.Example: dbserver1.inventory.orderlines:orderId,orderLineId;dbserver1.inventory.orders:id
properties.name: message.key.columns

properties.description: Specify whether the fields of data type not supported by Debezium should be processed:'false' (the default) omits the fields; 'true' converts the field into an implementation dependent binary representation.
properties.name: include.unknown.datatypes

properties.description: Specify the constant that will be provided by Debezium to indicate that the original value is a toasted value not provided by the database. If starts with 'hex:' prefix it is expected that the rest of the string repesents hexadecimally encoded octets.
properties.name: toasted.value.placeholder

properties.description: Enables transaction metadata extraction together with event counting
properties.displayName: Store transaction metadata information in a dedicated topic.
properties.name: provide.transaction.metadata

properties.description: Whether field names will be sanitized to Avro naming conventions
properties.displayName: Sanitize field names to adhere to Avro naming conventions
properties.name: sanitize.field.names

properties.description: The comma-separated list of operations to skip during streaming, defined as: 'c' for inserts/create; 'u' for updates; 'd' for deletes. By default, no operations will be skipped.
properties.name: skipped.operations

properties.description: Specify how failures during processing of events (i.e. when encountering a corrupted event) should be handled, including:'fail' (the default) an exception indicating the problematic event and its position is raised, causing the connector to be stopped; 'warn' the problematic event and its position will be logged and the event will be skipped;'ignore' the problematic event will be skipped.
properties.name: event.processing.failure.handling.mode

properties.description: Maximum size of each batch of source records. Defaults to 2048.
properties.name: max.batch.size

properties.description: Maximum size of the queue for change events read from the database log but not yet recorded or forwarded. Defaults to 8192, and should always be larger than the maximum batch size.
properties.name: max.queue.size

properties.description: Time to wait for new change events to appear after receiving no events, given in milliseconds. Defaults to 500 ms.
properties.name: poll.interval.ms

properties.description: Time to wait before restarting connector after retriable exception occurs. Defaults to 10000ms.
properties.name: retriable.restart.connector.wait.ms

properties.description: A version of the format of the publicly visible source part in the message
properties.name: source.struct.version
